snippet: A Moody’s survey found that nearly half of colleges and universities expect enrollment declines for full-time students, with problems more acute at smaller schools.
abstract: Report by Moody's Investors Service finds that nearly half of all colleges and universities expect lower enrollment for full-time students, and a third of schools expect tuition revenue to decline or to grow at less the rate of inflation, with problems more acute at smaller schools.
lead_paragraph: A Moody’s survey found that nearly half of colleges and universities expect enrollment declines for full-time students, with problems more acute at smaller schools.

headline.main: Downturn Still Squeezes Colleges and Universities
headline.print_headline: Downturn Still Squeezes Colleges and Universities
